resources.string:
Let’s take a look at another example 

When you installed this app on your mobile, you went to the app store and hit the install button.

It’s not only for this app. Rather you used the same process to install other apps.

Every time you want to install apps 
 1.you go to the play store 
 2. hit the install button. 

This means, you repeat the same process again and again for every app you want to install on your phone.
Hence installing apps is a repeatable task, and therefore installing apps is also a program.

num1 = 1.5 
num2 = 6.3 

# Add two numbers 

sum = float(num1) + float(num2) 

# Display the sum 
 
 print('The sum of 0 and 1 is ,sum))

If you want to get the premium version of programming hero and unlock all module . You need to share this app to your 5 friends and help us to grow otherwise to buy us a coffee to get energy back and add more functionality to this app.

Wanted to have fun! 

That’s why we created programming hero so that you can have fun as well. From now on, we have only one mission: Make learning fun and enjoyable as if you are watching your favorite movie, visiting your favorite place. We were a team of two: Jhankar Mahbub and Shuvojit Kar. We were highly supported by Shahan Chowdhury, Dennis Bohr, Karina Islam, Joel Karzmuruski and Sebastian Kurpiel.

Then we were blessed and helped by Hasibul hasan Shanto, Kazi Mashry, and Maliha Kabir. Now we are a community.
